body_html:
There are two errors that are fatal. I'm not sure which one is the root cause.

d:\usefullib\pytorch\build\aten\src\aten\native\cpu\gridsamplerkernel.cpp.avx2.cpp(812): note: See instantiating "at::native::`anonymous" for the class template being compiled -namespace'::ApplyGridSample<scalar_t,2,at::native::detail::GridSamplerInterpolation::Nearest,at::native::detail::GridSamplerPadding::Reflection>"
    14>d:\usefullib\pytorch\build\aten\src\aten\native\cpu\gridsamplerkernel.cpp.avx2.cpp(616): error C2893: The function template "at::vec256::`anonymous- Namespace'::Vec256<int_of_size<sizeof(T)>::type> at::vec256::`anonymous-namespace'::convert_to_int_of_same_size(const at::vec256::`anonymous-namespace'::Vec256<T> &)" specialization [D:\usefullib\pytorch\build\caffe2\caffe2.vcxproj]
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\build\aten\src\aten\native\cpu\gridsamplerkernel.cpp.avx2.cpp(616): note: Use the following template parameters:
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\build\aten\src\aten\native\cpu\gridsamplerkernel.cpp.avx2.cpp(616): note: “T=scalar_t”
    14>d:\usefullib\pytorch\build\aten\src\aten\native\cpu\gridsamplerkernel.cpp.avx2.cpp(620): error C3536: “i_x_nearest”: Cannot be used before initialization [D:\usefullib\pytorch \build\caffe2\caffe2.vcxproj]
    14>d:\usefullib\pytorch\build\aten\src\aten\native\cpu\gridsamplerkernel.cpp.avx2.cpp(620): error C2678: Binary ">": No left operation accepting "int" type Number operator (or no acceptable conversion) [D:\usefullib\pytorch\build\caffe2\caffe2.vcxproj]
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\tensoroperators.h(93): note: Probably "at::Tensor at::operator >(at::Scalar,const at::Tensor &)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\tensoroperators.h(93): note: or "at::Tensor at::operator >(const at::Tensor &,at::Scalar)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\tensoroperators.h(93): note: or "at::Tensor at::operator >(const at::Tensor &,const at::Tensor &)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\build\aten\src\aten\native\cpu\gridsamplerkernel.cpp.avx2.cpp(620): note: Try matching the parameter list "(int, at::vec256::`anonymous-namespace '::Vec256<int32_t>)"
    14>d:\usefullib\pytorch\build\aten\src\aten\native\cpu\gridsamplerkernel.cpp.avx2.cpp(620): error C2678: Binary "<": No left operation accepting "int" type Number operator (or no acceptable conversion) [D:\usefullib\pytorch\build\caffe2\caffe2.vcxproj]
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\tensoroperators.h(93): note: Probably "at::Tensor at::operator <(at::Scalar,const at::Tensor &)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\tensoroperators.h(93): note: or "at::Tensor at::operator <(const at::Tensor &,at::Scalar)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\tensoroperators.h(93): note: or "at::Tensor at::operator <(const at::Tensor &,const at::Tensor &)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\build\aten\src\aten\native\cpu\gridsamplerkernel.cpp.avx2.cpp(620): note: Try matching the parameter list "(int, at::vec256::`anonymous-namespace '::Vec256<int32_t>)"
    14>d:\usefullib\pytorch\build\aten\src\aten\native\cpu\gridsamplerkernel.cpp.avx2.cpp(623): error C2678: Binary "+": not found accept "at::vec256:: The operator of the left operand of the `anonymous-namespace'::Vec256<int32_t>" type (or no acceptable conversion) [D:\usefullib\pytorch\build\caffe2\caffe2.vcxproj]
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\tensoroperators.h(93): note: Probably "at::Tensor at::operator +(at::Scalar,const at::Tensor &)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\tensoroperators.h(93): note: or "at::Tensor at::operator +(const at::Tensor &,at::Scalar)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\tensoroperators.h(93): note: or “at::Tensor at::operator +(const at::Tensor &,const at::Tensor &)”
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\core\half-inl.h(207): note: or "at::Half at::operator +(long,at::Half)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\core\half-inl.h(194): note: or "at::Half at::operator +(at::Half,long)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\core\half-inl.h(180): note: or "at::Half at::operator +(int,at::Half)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\core\half-inl.h(167): note: or "at::Half at::operator +(at::Half,int)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\core\half-inl.h(152): note: or "double at::operator +(double,at::Half)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\core\half-inl.h(139): note: or "double at::operator +(at::Half,double)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\core\half-inl.h(111): note: or “float at::operator +(float,at::Half)”
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\core\half-inl.h(98): note: or “float at::operator +(at::Half,float)”
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\core\half-inl.h(56): note: or "at::Half at::operator +(const at::Half &,const at::Half &)"

I don't know what type scalar_t is in the first error. While the second message implies that we are missing some templates for the given types <int, at:Vec256<int32_t>>, I don't know if it is the case. If it is the case, why doesn't it throw on earlier MSVC versions?

body:
There are two errors that are fatal. I'm not sure which one is the root cause.
```
d:\usefullib\pytorch\build\aten\src\aten\native\cpu\gridsamplerkernel.cpp.avx2.cpp(812): note: See instantiating "at::native::`anonymous" for the class template being compiled -namespace'::ApplyGridSample<scalar_t,2,at::native::detail::GridSamplerInterpolation::Nearest,at::native::detail::GridSamplerPadding::Reflection>"

         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\tensoroperators.h(93): note: Probably "at::Tensor at::operator >(at::Scalar,const at::Tensor &)"

         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\tensoroperators.h(93): note: or "at::Tensor at::operator <(const at::Tensor &,at::Scalar)"
         d:\usefullib\pytorch\aten\src\aten\tensoroperators.h(93): note: or "at::Tensor at::operator <(const at::Tensor &,const at::Tensor &)"

```
I don't know what type `scalar_t` is in the first error. While the second message implies that we are missing some templates for the given types <int, at:Vec256<int32_t>>, I don't know if it is the case. If it is the case, why doesn't it throw on earlier MSVC versions?
